question: 2 (d)
sols_html:
The answer is true

From Fermat’s Little Theorem, we have

\(\displaystyle 2^{6} \equiv 1\mod{7}\)

and hence

\(\displaystyle 2^{39} \equiv (2^{6})^{6} \cdot 2^{3} \equiv (1)^{6} \cdot 8 \equiv 8 \equiv 1 \mod{7}\)

Thus 7 divides \(\displaystyle 2^{39}-1\).
